messages: a1fbe72f47651e50181e743dc550aeee (06:30): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Is there an updated timeline beyond the FAQ, given today's Last Call?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:31): http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/TIMETABLE is the only timeline so far
a1fbe72f47651e50181e743dc550aeee (06:32): oh, so, everything's on schedule then?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:32): at least in the WHATWG!
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:32): The W3C's timetable... not so much
a1fbe72f47651e50181e743dc550aeee (06:33): I'm leaving the WHATWG as the definitive source for HTML5 ;)
a1fbe72f47651e50181e743dc550aeee (06:33): is it conceivable that work on HTML6 will begin before REC for HTML5?
a1fbe72f47651e50181e743dc550aeee (06:35): Also, what's the plan for the test suite(s)?
a1fbe72f47651e50181e743dc550aeee (06:35): in terms of contributing, etc.
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (06:51): http://diveintohtml5.org/semantics.html
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (06:51): please stop changing the semantics now
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (06:52): ah, almost standards mode
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (07:00): ok now i've written a bunch of tests for script parsing and the other r|cdata elements
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (07:02): http://code.google.com/p/html5lib/source/browse/testdata/tree-construction/tests16.dat
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (07:02): hope they're correct
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:05): a1fbe72f47651e50181e743dc550aeee: very conceivable
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:06): a1fbe72f47651e50181e743dc550aeee: no plan really yet... if you want to be in charge of the test suite, it's definitely something that needs doing :-)
a1fbe72f47651e50181e743dc550aeee (07:06): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Is there a scratchpad for what might be in HTML6?
a1fbe72f47651e50181e743dc550aeee (07:06): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Heh. That seems like quite a task to take on.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (07:07): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46, reading that, all these <!--<script --> cases seem pretty counterintuitive
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:07): a1fbe72f47651e50181e743dc550aeee: search for "v2" in the source
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:07): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6: yeah no kidding
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (07:08): hmm, if there is a line break between <!-- and <script> or <style>, is it okay then?
a1fbe72f47651e50181e743dc550aeee (07:08): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Someone should make a script that scrapes them out. :)
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (07:09): or doesn't that affect parsing at all?
a1fbe72f47651e50181e743dc550aeee (07:09): runs and hides
a1fbe72f47651e50181e743dc550aeee (07:09): alright, I think it's time for bed
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:10): nn
a1fbe72f47651e50181e743dc550aeee (07:10): g'night/g'morning :P
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (07:15): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6: doesn't affect parsing
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (07:23): 61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19: there are an infinite number of doctypes that trigger standards mode
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:25): so what's the stylistically preferred way to write the HTML5 doctype in a document?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:26): I always write <!DOCTYPE html> but maybe all-lowercase would be more elegant
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (07:26): i prefer <!doctype html> because i don't like holding down shift
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:27): the WHATWG copy of the HTML5 spec has it as <!DOCTYPE html>
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:28): google's homepage does <!doctype html>
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:32): I <3 Professor Markup
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (07:34): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: any opinion about http://bugzilla.validator.nu/show_bug.cgi?id=488 (add obsolete attributes to assertions checking)
bd1556d73616e05539b749a6231dd993 (07:34): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: probably lowercase, since it might benefit from gzipping html tags that are lowercase
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (07:35): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c, i bet if you ask hixie he will say that its okay to be inconsistent in examples, to show what is possible ;)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:35): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6: I'm thinking about good style for documents that I write for purposes other than markup pedagogy

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (07:35): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: I seem to remember having a discussion about that with you, that you reckoned it would be good to explicitly report about obsolete attributes
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:36): I like to use good style if I can
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (07:36): othree_, all lowercase. uppercase tags are sooooo 1997
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (07:38): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: yeah, i think it would be nice
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:44): personally i prefer <!DOCTYPE HTML>

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:46): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: we're going to have to start giving everyone who comments or files on bugs the rights to reopen the bugs, because i've gotten very close to missing bugs because the commentor couldn't reopen it
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (07:47): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: OK
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:48): ( http://www.reddit.com/r/programming/comments/9yejl/whats_the_biggest_programming_mistake_youve_ever/c0f13p2 )
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (07:50): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: OK, I will try to get it added today
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (07:50): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: cool
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:59): 61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19__: IE's DOM s even weirder than what you say - I think it also makes an empty element with a tag name of "/article"

73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (08:05): 61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19__: "To ease migration to and from XHTML, authors may specify an attribute in no namespace with no prefix and with the literal localname "xml:lang" on <html> elements" - should be "HTML elements"
